title: How to use PANACEA
text: Identification appropriate pharmacotherapy patient based genomic alterations major challenge personalized oncology. PANACEA collection personalized anti-cancer drug prioritization approaches utilizing network methods. methods utilize personalized “driverness” scores driveR rank drugs, mapping onto protein-protein interaction network (PIN). “distance-based” method scores drug based scores distances drugs genes rank given drugs. “RWR” method propagates scores via random-walk restart framework rank drugs. wrapper function score_drugs() can used score rank drugs individual tumor sample via “distance-based” “RWR” method. required inputs : driveR_res: data frame driveR results. Details obtain driveR output provided vignette drug_interactions_df: data frame drug-gene interactions (defaults interactions DGIdb expert-curated sources) W_mat: (symmetric) adjacency matrix PIN (defaults STRING v11.5 interactions combined score > .4) method: scoring method (one “distance-based” “RWR”)

title: How to use PANACEA
text: vignette, driveR results lung adenocarcinoma case, example_driveR_res, used example input dataset. Details obtain driveR output provided vignette.
code: head(example_driveR_res) #>   gene_symbol driverness_prob prediction #> 1       IFNA7      0.18945527 non-driver #> 2        TJP1      0.13935021 non-driver #> 3      IL20RA      0.09266710 non-driver #> 4        SOST      0.08017132 non-driver #> 5       NCOA2      0.06734062 non-driver #> 6        ARAF      0.06232757 non-driver

title: How to use PANACEA
text: method, score drug, d, altered gene, g, defined : \[score(g, d) = \frac{1}{(dist(g,d) + 1)^2} driver\_prob_g\] \(dist(g,d)\) distance g d within PIN, \(driver\_prob_g\) driverness probability obtained driveR. final score drug calculated average scores altered gene d: \[score(d) = \sum_{g \G} \frac{1}{|G|} score(g,d)\] G set altered genes. Scoring drugs example lung adenocarcinoma case example_driveR_res via “distance-based” method can performed follows: scores ranks drugs via “distance-based” method using drug-gene interactions DGIdb expert-curated sources STRING v11.5 PIN combined score > 700. , top 10 drugs printed:
code: example_scores_dist <- score_drugs(example_driveR_res, method = "distance-based") head(example_scores_dist, 10) #>    EVEROLIMUS PEMBROLIZUMAB     CISPLATIN     LETROZOLE     CETUXIMAB  #>   0.009405251   0.008960906   0.008960906   0.008900282   0.008755715  #>  BICALUTAMIDE     SORAFENIB   ENCORAFENIB   REGORAFENIB    TRAMETINIB  #>   0.008755715   0.008523904   0.008523904   0.008523904   0.008523904

title: How to use PANACEA
text: method, random-walk restart framework used propagate driverness probabilities. drug’s final score final propagation score. Scoring drugs example lung adenocarcinoma case example_driveR_res via “RWR” method can performed follows: scores ranks drugs via “RWR” method using drug-gene interactions DGIdb expert-curated sources STRING v11.5 PIN combined score > 700. , top 10 drugs printed:
code: example_scores_RWR <- score_drugs(example_driveR_res, method = "RWR") head(example_scores_RWR, 10) #>               BLOSOZUMAB;ROMOSOZUMAB              TIAGABINE HYDROCHLORIDE  #>                         0.0008476627                         0.0004770740  #>                              KRN-330                            SERELAXIN  #>                         0.0004326723                         0.0003804546  #>                            TIAGABINE           LY-3009120;MLN-2480;XL-281  #>                         0.0003554924                         0.0002520392  #>                          OCRIPLASMIN                          ENCORAFENIB  #>                         0.0002386693                         0.0002312123  #> COLLAGENASE CLOSTRIDIUM HISTOLYTICUM                              COCAINE  #>                         0.0002245975                         0.0002227435

title: Personalized Network-Based Anti-Cancer Therapy Evaluation
text: Identification appropriate pharmacotherapy patient based genomic alterations major challenge personalized oncology. PANACEA collection personalized anti-cancer drug prioritization approaches utilizing network methods. methods utilize personalized “driverness” scores driveR rank drugs, mapping onto protein-protein interaction network. “distance-based” method scores drug based scores distances drugs genes rank given drugs. “RWR” method propagates scores via random-walk restart framework rank drugs. method described detail Ulgen E, Ozisik O, Sezerman OU. PANACEA: network-based methods pharmacotherapy prioritization personalized oncology. Bioinformatics. 2023 Jan 1;39(1):btad022. https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btad022 PANACEA workflow

title: Personalized Network-Based Anti-Cancer Therapy Evaluation
text: can install latest release version PANACEA CRAN via: can install development version PANACEA GitHub :
code: install.packages("PANACEA") # install.packages("devtools") @ if you don't have devtools installed devtools::install_github("egeulgen/PANACEA", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Personalized Network-Based Anti-Cancer Therapy Evaluation
text: wrapper function score_drugs() can used score rank drugs individual tumor sample via “distance-based” “RWR” method. required inputs : driveR_res: data frame driveR results. Details obtain driveR output provided vignette drug_interactions_df: data frame drug-gene interactions (defaults interactions DGIdb expert-curated sources) W_mat: (symmetric) adjacency matrix protein interaction network (defaults STRING v11.5 interactions combined score > .4) method: scoring method (one “distance-based” “RWR”)

what: PANACEA: Personalized Network-based Anti-Cancer Therapy Evaluation — PANACEA
title: PANACEA: Personalized Network-based Anti-Cancer Therapy Evaluation — PANACEA
text: Identification appropriate pharmacotherapy patient based genomic alterations major challenge personalized oncology. PANACEA collection personalized anti-cancer drug prioritization approaches utilizing network methods. methods utilize personalized "driverness" scores 'driveR' rank drugs, mapping onto protein-protein interaction network (PIN). "distance-based" method scores drug based scores distances drugs genes rank given drugs. "RWR" method propagates scores via random-walk restart framework rank drugs.

title: Network Propagation (Random-walk with Restart) — network_propagation
text: prior_vec vector prior knowledge selected genes (names gene symbols) W_prime (Laplacian-normalized, symmetric) adjacency matrix alpha restart parameter, controlling trade-prior information network smoothing max.iter maximum allowed number iterations (default = 1000) eps epsilon value assess L2 norm difference iterations (default = 1e-4)

text: vector propagation values

title: Network Propagation (Random-walk with Restart) — network_propagation
text: Implementing RWR following following publications: Cowen L, Ideker T, Raphael BJ, Sharan R. Network propagation: universal amplifier genetic associations. Nat Rev Genet. 2017 Sep;18(9):551–62. Shnaps O, Perry E, Silverbush D, Sharan R. Inference personalized drug targets via network propagation. Pac Symp Biocomput. 2016;21:156–67.

Scoring of Drugs via Network-based Methods — score_drugs
text: driveR_res data frame driveR results drug_interactions_df data frame drug-gene interactions W_mat adjacency matrix PIN method scoring method (one 'distance-based' 'RWR') ... additional arguments score_drugs_distance_based score_drugs_RWR_based

title: Scoring of Drugs via Network-based Methods — score_drugs
text: vector scores per drug.

title: Scoring of Drugs via Network-based Methods — score_drugs
text: wrapper function two proposed methods personalized scoring drugs individual cancer samples via network-based methods. available methods 'distance-based' 'RWR'. 'distance-based' method, score gene (g) drug (d) formulated : $$score(g, d) = driver(g) / (d(g, d) + 1)^2$$ driver(g) driverness probability gene g, predicted 'driveR' d(g, d) distance withing PIN gene g drug d. final score drug d average scores altered gene d: $$score(d) = \Sigma{score(g, d)} / |genes|$$ 'RWR' method, random-walk restart framework used propagate driverness probabilities. default DGIdb_interactions_df used drug_interactions_df. W_mat argument supplied, built-STRNG data STRING_adj_df used generate W_mat.

title: Scoring of Drugs via Network-based Methods — score_drugs
code: toy_data <- data.frame(   gene_symbol = c("TP53", "EGFR", "KDR", "ATM"),   driverness_prob = c(0.94, 0.92, 0.84, 0.72) ) toy_interactions <- DGIdb_interactions_df[1:25, ] res <- score_drugs(   driveR_res = toy_data,   drug_interactions_df = toy_interactions, # leave blank for default   W_mat = toy_W_mat, # leave blank for default   method = "distance-based",   verbose = FALSE ) #>

title: RWR-based Scoring of Drugs — score_drugs_RWR_based
text: RWR-based Scoring Drugs

title: RWR-based Scoring of Drugs — score_drugs_RWR_based
code: score_drugs_RWR_based(   driveR_res,   drug_interactions_df,   W_mat,   alpha = 0.05,   max.iter = 1000,   eps = 1e-04,   drug_name_col = "drug_name",   target_col = "gene_name",   verbose = TRUE )

title: RWR-based Scoring of Drugs — score_drugs_RWR_based
text: driveR_res data frame driveR results drug_interactions_df data frame drug-gene interactions W_mat adjacency matrix PIN alpha restart parameter, controlling trade-prior information network smoothing max.iter maximum allowed number iterations (default = 1000) eps epsilon value assess L2 norm difference iterations (default = 1e-4) drug_name_col 'drug_interactions_df', column name containing drug names/identifiers target_col 'drug_interactions_df', column name containing target gene symbols verbose boolean control verbosity (default = TRUE)

title: RWR-based Scoring of Drugs — score_drugs_RWR_based
text: vector scores per drug. Drugs target gene(s) merged (via process_drug_target_interactions)

title: RWR-based Scoring of Drugs — score_drugs_RWR_based
code: toy_data <- data.frame(   gene_symbol = c("TP53", "EGFR", "KDR", "ATM"),   driverness_prob = c(0.94, 0.92, 0.84, 0.72) ) toy_interactions <- DGIdb_interactions_df[1:100, ] res <- score_drugs_RWR_based(   driveR_res = toy_data,   drug_interactions_df = toy_interactions,   W_mat = toy_W_mat, verbose = FALSE )

title: Distance-based Scoring of Drugs — score_drugs_distance_based
text: driveR_res data frame driveR results drug_interactions_df data frame drug-gene interactions W_mat adjacency matrix PIN driver_prob_cutoff cut-value 'driverness_prob' (default = 0.05) drug_name_col 'drug_interactions_df', column name containing drug names/identifiers target_col 'drug_interactions_df', column name containing target gene symbols verbose boolean control verbosity (default = TRUE)

title: Distance-based Scoring of Drugs — score_drugs_distance_based
text: vector scores per drug. Drugs target gene(s) merged (via process_drug_target_interactions)

title: Distance-based Scoring of Drugs — score_drugs_distance_based
code: toy_data <- data.frame(   gene_symbol = c("TP53", "EGFR", "KDR", "ATM"),   driverness_prob = c(0.94, 0.92, 0.84, 0.72) ) toy_interactions <- DGIdb_interactions_df[1:100, ] res <- score_drugs_distance_based(   driveR_res = toy_data,   drug_interactions_df = toy_interactions,   W_mat = toy_W_mat, verbose = FALSE )
